com.coremedia.iso

Class IsoFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coremedia.iso.IsoFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Box, ContainerBox, Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterator<Box>

    @DoNotParseDetail
public class IsoFile
extends Object
implements Closeable, Iterator<Box>, ContainerBox
    The most upper container for ISO Boxes. It is a container box that is a file. Uses IsoBufferWrapper to access the underlying file.

        public IsoFile(String filename)
        throws IOException
        Shortcut constructor that creates a FileChannel from the given filename and pass it to the IsoFile(java.nio.channels.FileChannel) constructor.
        Parameters:
        filename - of the MP4 file to be parsed
        Throws:
        IOException - in case I/O error

      • IsoFile

        public IsoFile(FileChannel fileChannel)
        throws IOException
        Creates a new IsoFile from a FileChannel. Uses memory-mapping to save heap memory.
        Parameters:
        fileChannel - the source file
        Throws:
        IOException - in case I/O error

      • IsoFile

        public IsoFile(ReadableByteChannel byteChannel)
        throws IOException
        Deprecated. use IsoFile(FileChannel) to save heap
        Creates a new IsoFile from a ReadableByteChannel.

        Try to use IsoFile(FileChannel) so you can benefit from FileChannel.map(java.nio.channels.FileChannel.MapMode, long, long). It will reduce your heap requirements drastically!

        Parameters:
        byteChannel - the data source
        Throws:
        IOException - in case I/O error

       BoxParser boxParser)
        throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • parse

        public void parse(ReadableByteChannel readableByteChannel,
         ByteBuffer header,
         long contentSize,
         BoxParser boxParser)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Box
        Parses the box excluding the already parsed header (size, 4cc, [long-size], [user-type]). The remaining size of the box is the contentSize, contentSize number of bytes should be read from the box source (readableByteChannel). If you need the header buffer at a later stage you have to create a copy.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface Box
        Parameters:
        readableByteChannel - the box' source
        header - the box' already parsed header (create copy if you need it later as it will be overwritten)
        contentSize - remaining bytes of this box
        boxParser - use it to parse sub-boxes.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of an error during a read operation
